result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be transferred to Dodge County.  The Court will grant early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of probation and agent recommendation.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  No violent contact with Catherine W. No contact with Amanda Z or her residence.  The Court will permit the Defendant to attend Formation Weekend Event in Rockford, Illinois May 13 - May 15, 2016.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Wilson

records.addlTxt: From Atty Connors received by the Court 5/10/16 with attached character letters.
Sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alexander M Wilson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.   Attorney Connors requests a future sentencing date.  The State does not object and the Court schedules accordingly.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Alexander M Wilson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gordon advises the Court the parties are ready to proceed to trial.  The Court will address the motion in limine tomorrow morning as well as jury instructions throughout the trial.  The State will have a maximum of 3 witnessess and the State will advise Attorney Connors as to the exact names of the witnesses.  The trial is expected to last one day.  Exhibits State 1-99 and Defensen 100+ and to be marked prior to the trial.
